Interface GameObject

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractGameObject, Block, Magnet, Player
public interface GameObject

This interface serves as the base for all GameObjects in this Game. GameObjects are any Object that exists within a World and can be placed and removed from its enclosing World Object. Objects implementing the Movable interface are also capable of changing their position within the World they exist in. Objects implementing the Solid interface prevent Movable Object from moving into the area they occupy within a World.

Since:
April 4, 2011
Version:
1.0.0.12 : April 7, 2011
Author:
Mihail Kurbako
See Also:
Movable, Solid, AbstractGameObject, Player, Block, Engine

Method Detail

getX

int getX()
This method is used to retrieve the current X coordinate of a specific GameObject. Implementing classes must override this method.

Returns:
Returns the current X coordinate of this GameObject.

getHeight

int getHeight()
This method is used to retrieve the distance of the point on this GameObject that is farthest away from it's origin. (The origin is it's current X coordinate). Implementing classes must override this method.

Returns:
Returns the GameObject's vertical size.

getY

int getY()
This method is used to retrieve the current X coordinate of a specific GameObject. Implementing classes must override this method.

Returns:
Returns the current Y coordinate of this GameObject.

getWidth

int getWidth()
This method is used to retrieve the distance of the point on this GameObject that is farthest away from it's origin. (The origin is it's current Y coordinate). Implementing classes must override this method.

Returns:
Returns the GameObject's horizontal size.

addSelfToWorld

void addSelfToWorld(World<GameObject> world)
This method places the GameObject onto the specified grid, and assigns it's value to a field within the GameObject for future reference to the Object. Implementing classes must override this method.

Parameters:
world - The World Object into which this GameObject will be placed.
See Also:
World

getEnclosingWorld

World<GameObject> getEnclosingWorld()
This method gives access to the stored value for the World Object that this gameObject exists within. Implementing classes must override this method.

Returns:
If the GameObject exists within a World, returns that World Object, otherwise null.
See Also:
World

removeSelfFromWorld

void removeSelfFromWorld()
Removes the GameObject from the World Object that it's value is currently enclosed within. Also sets the value for the field that stores the current value for the World Object to null. If the GameObject is not in a World when this method is called, it will perform no action.

See Also:
World
